title: The Shawshank Redemption
movie_plot: Two imprisoned men bond over a number of years, finding solace and eventual redemption through acts of common decency.
awards: Nominated for 7 Academy Awards

title: The Godfather
movie_plot: The aging patriarch of an organized crime dynasty transfers control of his clandestine empire to his reluctant son.
awards: Won 3 Academy Awards, including Best Picture

title: The Dark Knight
movie_plot: When the menace known as the Joker wreaks havoc and chaos on the people of Gotham, Batman must accept one of the greatest psychological and physical tests of his ability to fight injustice.
awards: Won 2 Academy Awards, including Best Supporting Actor for Heath Ledger

title: Pulp Fiction
movie_plot: The lives of two mob hitmen, a boxer, a gangster's wife, and a pair of diner bandits intertwine in four tales of violence and redemption.
awards: Won Academy Award for Best Original Screenplay

title: Forrest Gump
movie_plot: The presidencies of Kennedy and Johnson, the Vietnam War, the Watergate scandal and other historical events unfold from the perspective of an Alabama man with an IQ of 75, whose only desire is to be reunited with his childhood sweetheart.
awards: Won 6 Academy Awards, including Best Picture

title: Inception
movie_plot: A thief who steals corporate secrets through the use of dream-sharing technology is given the inverse task of planting an idea into the mind of a C.E.O.
awards: Won 4 Academy Awards

title: The Matrix
movie_plot: A computer hacker learns from mysterious rebels about the true nature of his reality and his role in the war against its controllers.
awards: Won 4 Academy Awards

title: Goodfellas
movie_plot: The story of Henry Hill and his life in the mob, covering his relationship with his wife Karen Hill and his mob partners Jimmy Conway and Tommy DeVito in the Italian-American crime syndicate.
awards: Won Academy Award for Best Supporting Actor for Joe Pesci

title: The Lord of the Rings: The Fellowship of the Ring
writer: J.R.R. Tolkien, Fran Walsh, Philippa Boyens, Peter Jackson
movie: The Lord of the Rings: The Fellowship of the Ring
movie_plot: A meek Hobbit from the Shire and eight companions set out on a journey to destroy the powerful One Ring and save Middle-earth from the Dark Lord Sauron.
awards: Won 4 Academy Awards

title: Fight Club
movie_plot: An insomniac office worker and a soap maker form an underground fight club that evolves into something much more.
awards: Nominated for Academy Award for Best Sound Editing

title: Se7en
movie_plot: Two detectives, a rookie and a veteran, hunt a serial killer who uses the seven deadly sins as his motives.
awards: Nominated for Academy Award for Best Film Editing

title: Gladiator
writer: David Franzoni, John Logan, William Nicholson
movie_plot: A former Roman General sets out to exact revenge against the corrupt, cowardly emperor who murdered his family and sent him into slavery.
awards: Won 5 Academy Awards, including Best Picture

title: Saving Private Ryan
movie_plot: Following the Normandy Landings, a group of U.S. soldiers go behind enemy lines to retrieve a paratrooper whose brothers have been killed in action.
awards: Won 5 Academy Awards, including Best Director

title: The Silence of the Lambs
movie_plot: A young F.B.I. cadet must receive the help of an incarcerated and manipulative cannibal killer to catch another serial killer, a madman who skins his victims.
awards: Won 5 Academy Awards, including Best Picture

title: The Usual Suspects
movie_plot: A sole survivor tells of the twisty events leading up to a horrific gun battle on a boat, which are all part of a complex plot run by an enigmatic crime lord.
awards: Won 2 Academy Awards

title: Titanic
movie_plot: A seventeen-year-old aristocrat falls in love with a kind but poor artist aboard the luxurious, ill-fated RMS Titanic.
awards: Won 11 Academy Awards, including Best Picture

title: Star Wars: Episode IV - A New Hope
movie: Star Wars: Episode IV - A New Hope
movie_plot: Luke Skywalker joins forces with a Jedi Knight, a cocky pilot, a Wookiee, and two droids to save the galaxy from the Empire's world-destroying battle station, while also attempting to rescue Princess Leia from the evil Darth Vader.
awards: Won 6 Academy Awards

title: Braveheart
movie_plot: Scottish warrior William Wallace leads his countrymen in a rebellion to free his homeland from the tyrannical rule of King Edward I of England.
awards: Won 5 Academy Awards, including Best Picture

title: The Green Mile
movie_plot: The lives of guards on Death Row are affected by one of their charges: a black man accused of child murder and rape, who has a mysterious gift.
awards: Nominated for 4 Academy Awards

title: The Lion King
writer: Irene Mecchi, Jonathan Roberts, Linda Woolverton
movie_plot: Lion prince Simba and his father are usurped by his treacherous uncle, Scar, and Simba must take his rightful place as king of the Pride Lands.
awards: Won 2 Academy Awards

title: Django Unchained
movie_plot: With the help of a German bounty hunter, a freed slave sets out to rescue his wife from a brutal Mississippi plantation owner.
awards: Won 2 Academy Awards

title: Inglourious Basterds
movie_plot: In Nazi-occupied France during World War II, a plan to assassinate Nazi leaders by a group of Jewish U.S. soldiers coincides with a theater owner's plan to do the same.
awards: Won Academy Award for Best Supporting Actor for Christoph Waltz

title: Jurassic Park
movie_plot: A pragmatic paleontologist touring an island theme park of genetically engineered dinosaurs is tasked with protecting a couple of kids after a power failure causes the creatures to run amok.
awards: Won 3 Academy Awards

title: Back to the Future
movie_plot: Marty McFly, a 17-year-old high school student, is accidentally sent 30 years into the past in a time-traveling DeLorean invented by his eccentric scientist friend Doc Brown.
awards: Won Academy Award for Best Sound Effects Editing

title: Toy Story
writer: Joss Whedon, Andrew Stanton, Joel Cohen, Alec Sokolow
movie_plot: A cowboy doll is profoundly threatened and jealous when a new spaceman figure supplants him as a boy's favorite toy.
awards: Nominated for 3 Academy Awards
